definition: to hit home on the evils of the day (idiom); fig. to hit a current political target/to hit the nub of the matter
to strongly criticize the evils of the day

sentences.english: Next has the ancient form of acupuncture evil of the age's practical significance.
sentences.chinese: 其次具有鍼砭時弊的現實意義。

sentences.english: He started to become more self-conscious to regard letter as the weapon to condemn the social abuses.
sentences.chinese: 他開始更加自覺的將文字視作鍼砭時弊的武器。

sentences.english: The proposal of every literary theory by Yang Shen can hit the social problems of the times.
sentences.chinese: 楊慎每個文章理論觀點的提出，皆能切中時弊。

sentences.english: The book diagnoses our present economic ills.
sentences.chinese: 這本書切中了我們現在經濟的時弊。

sentences.english: He became a progressively harsh and disillusioned critic of his country's failings.
sentences.chinese: 他成了一個摒棄一切幻想，嚴厲抨擊時弊的批評家。
